thinkpol.utils package¶

Submodules¶

thinkpol.utils.connection module¶

class thinkpol.utils.connection.Connection(sock)¶

Bases: object

Wraps a socket with functions that enable sending and receiving whole messages. Provides a send_message, receive_message, connect and close methods. Also functions as a context manager using connect and close.

Parameters

sock (socket) – the socket that the connection wraps

close()¶
classmethod connect(host, port)¶

Creates a new socket connected to host:port, wraps it in a Connection object and returns that.

Parameters

  • host (str) – the host we connect to

  • port (str) – the port we connect to

Returns

the Connection object connected to host:port

Return type

Connection

receive(size)¶
receive_message()¶

Receives the size of message in bytes, and then message itself.

Returns

the binary message (without the size prepended)

Return type

bytes

send(data)¶
send_message(data)¶

Sends a chunk of binary data with its size prepended to it in binary.

Parameters

data (bytes) – the binary data we’re sending

thinkpol.utils.listener module¶

class thinkpol.utils.listener.Listener(port, host='0.0.0.0', backlog=1000, reuseaddr=True)¶

Bases: object

Wraps a socket in functions that enable it to operate like a server socket. Provides start, stop and accept methods. Also functions as a context manager with start and stop.

Parameters

  • port (int) – the socket’s port

  • host (str, optional) – the socket’s host, defaults to localhost

  • backlog (int, optional) – the amount of clients the socket handles, defaults to 1000

  • reuseaddr (boolean, optional) – whether we cancel cooling off the socket’s port to allow reusage, defaults to True

accept()¶

Accepts a new client through the socket.

Returns

a Connection object representing the connection to the client

Return type

Connection

start()¶

Starts listening on host:port through the socket.

stop()¶

Stops listening on host:port through the socket.

thinkpol.utils.protocol module¶

thinkpol.utils.snapshot module¶

class thinkpol.utils.snapshot.ImageData(fmt, width, height, data)¶

Bases: object

Represents a color/depth image, including its dimensions, format and data.

Parameters

  • fmt (str) – the image’s format (‘binary’ or ‘protobuf’)

  • width (int) – the image’s width

  • height (int) – the image’s height

  • data (bytes) – the image’s data

class thinkpol.utils.snapshot.Snapshot(datetime, translation, rotation, c_height, c_width, color_image, d_height, d_width, depth_image, hunger, thirst, exhaustion, happiness)¶

Bases: object

Represents a snapshot read from a formatted binary file. Provides methods for serializing/deserializing snapshot objects to/from binary data.

Parameters

  • datetime (int) – current time

  • translation (tuple) – 3-tuple of floats, represents current translation

  • rotation (tuple) – 4-tuple of floats, represents current rotation

  • c_height (int) – height of color image

  • c_width (int) – width of color image

  • color_image (ImageData) – an object representing the color image

  • d_height (int) – height of depth image

  • d_width (int) – width of depth image

  • depth_image (ImageData) – an object representing the depth image

  • hunger (float) – current level of hunger

  • thirst (float) – current level of thirst

  • exhaustion (float) – current level of exhaustion

  • happiness (float) – current level of happiness

classmethod deserialize(data)¶

Deserializes binary data representing a snapshot into a Snapshot object.

Parameters

data (bytes) – the data representing a snapshot

Returns

the new snapshot

Return type

Snapshot

classmethod from_bytes(bytes)¶

Initializes a snapshot by reading its data from a bytes object.

Parameters

bytes (bytes) – the source for the snapshot

Returns

the new snapshot

Return type

Snapshot

classmethod from_proto_stream(stream)¶

Initializes a snapshot by reading its data from a protobuf formatted bytes iterator.

Parameters

stream (iterable) – stream of snapshot data

Returns

the new snapshot

Return type

Snapshot

classmethod from_stream(stream)¶

Initializes a snapshot by reading its data from a bytes iterator.

Parameters

stream (iterable) – stream of snapshot data

Returns

the new snapshot

Return type

Snapshot

serialize()¶

Serializes the current snapshot into binary data, assuming we can parse exactly ‘pose’, ‘color_image’, ‘depth_image’ and ‘feelings’.

Returns

the serialized binary data

Return type

bytes

serialize_request(fields)¶

Serializes the current snapshot into binary data, including only the fields that exist in ‘fields’.

Parameters

fields (list) – a list of the names of the fields

Returns

the serialized binary data

Return type

bytes

thinkpol.utils.snapshot.read_data(stream, size)¶

Iteratively reads a specific size of binary data from a binary stream.

Parameters

  • stream (iterable) – the stream of data we read from

  • size (int) – the amount of data we read

Returns

the binary data we’ve just read

Return type

bytes
